description: CEFR C1 핵심 문법 - 고급 구문과 미묘한 뉘앙스

grammarPoints.name: ellipsis_substitution
grammarPoints.explanation: Use ellipsis and substitution to avoid repetition.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 반복을 피하기 위해 생략과 대용을 사용해요.

examples.en: I asked him to help, but he refused to.
She can speak French, and so can I.
examples.ko: 그녀는 프랑스어를 할 수 있고, 나도 마찬가지예요.

examples.en: If you want to leave, do so quietly.
Which one? The red one or the blue one?
examples.ko: 어떤 거요? 빨간 것 아니면 파란 것?

grammarPoints.koreanTip: 자연스러운 영어는 반복을 피해요. 조동사 뒤 생략, do so 대용이 중요해요.

commonErrors.wrong: I can swim and he can swim too.
commonErrors.correct: I can swim and so can he.

commonErrors.wrong: I wanted to go but I couldn't go.
commonErrors.correct: I wanted to go but I couldn't.

grammarPoints.name: fronting
grammarPoints.explanation: Move elements to the front for emphasis or cohesion.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 강조나 응집성을 위해 요소를 문장 앞으로 이동해요.

examples.en: This problem we must solve immediately.
Only then did I realize the truth.
Responsible for the project is Dr. Kim.
More important is the quality.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: 강조하고 싶은 요소를 문장 앞으로 이동해요. 격식체에서 많이 사용해요.

grammarPoints.name: nominal_relative
grammarPoints.explanation: Use what, whoever, whatever as nominal relatives.

examples.en: What matters is your attitude.
Whoever said that was wrong.
Do whatever you think is best.
Choose whichever you prefer.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: what = the thing that, whoever = anyone who의 의미예요.

commonErrors.wrong: The what he said was wrong.

grammarPoints.name: comment_clauses
grammarPoints.explanation: Use comment clauses to add speaker attitude.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 화자의 태도를 추가할 때 논평절을 사용해요.

forms.patterns: as far as I know, if you ask me, to be honest, generally speaking

examples.en: As far as I'm concerned, the matter is closed.
The plan, if you ask me, is flawed.
examples.ko: 제 생각에 그 계획은 결함이 있어요.

examples.en: Strictly speaking, this isn't correct.
To tell you the truth, I disagree.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: 화자의 관점이나 의견을 자연스럽게 삽입하는 표현들이에요.

grammarPoints.name: distancing
grammarPoints.explanation: Use distancing language to be cautious or tentative.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 신중하거나 조심스럽게 말할 때 거리두기 표현을 사용해요.

examples.en: It would appear that there's been a mistake.
The project is believed to be behind schedule.
examples.ko: 프로젝트가 일정보다 늦어진 것으로 알려져 있어요.

examples.en: They apparently decided not to proceed.
examples.ko: 그들은 진행하지 않기로 결정한 것 같아요.

examples.en: The company tends to favor internal candidates.
examples.ko: 그 회사는 내부 후보를 선호하는 경향이 있어요.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: 직접적인 표현을 피하고 완곡하게 말할 때 사용해요.

commonErrors.wrong: It seems that he is lying.
commonErrors.correct: It would seem that he might not be telling the truth.

grammarPoints.name: perfect_infinitive
grammarPoints.explanation: Use perfect infinitive for actions before the main verb.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 주동사보다 먼저 일어난 행동을 표현할 때 완료 부정사를 사용해요.

forms.usage: After modal verbs, after appear/seem, in reported speech

examples.en: He seems to have forgotten.
She claims to have met him.
I would like to have seen that.
He's lucky to have survived.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: '~했다고/~했던 것'의 의미로 현재보다 먼저 일어난 일을 표현해요.

grammarPoints.name: subjunctive_advanced
grammarPoints.explanation: Use advanced subjunctive forms in formal contexts.

forms.were_to: If + subject + were to + verb (remote condition)

examples.en: If he were to resign, who would replace him?
Should you need help, don't hesitate to ask.
Be that as it may, we must proceed.
examples.ko: 그것이 어찌 됐든 우리는 진행해야 해요.

examples.en: Were I in your position, I would accept.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: 가능성이 희박하거나 격식적인 상황에서 사용하는 고급 가정법이에요.

commonErrors.wrong: If you should need help, ask me.
commonErrors.correct: Should you need help, ask me.

grammarPoints.name: extraposition
grammarPoints.explanation: Use extraposition to manage complex subjects.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 복잡한 주어를 관리하기 위해 외치 구문을 사용해요.

examples.en: It is crucial that we act now.
It surprised me that she agreed.
It's no use complaining.
It remains to be seen whether...

grammarPoints.koreanTip: 긴 주어를 문장 뒤로 보내고 It을 형식 주어로 사용해요.

commonErrors.wrong: That we act now is crucial.
commonErrors.correct: It is crucial that we act now.

grammarPoints.name: continuous_aspect_extended
grammarPoints.explanation: Use continuous forms for special meanings.
grammarPoints.explanationKo: 특별한 의미를 위해 진행형을 확장하여 사용해요.

examples.en: He's being difficult today.
The climate is changing rapidly.
She's always interrupting people.
I'm loving this weather!

grammarPoints.koreanTip: 진행형은 임시 상황, 변화, 짜증스러운 반복 등을 표현할 수 있어요.

grammarPoints.name: concessive_clauses
grammarPoints.explanation: Use concessive clauses to acknowledge contrasts.

examples.en: Much as I respect him, I disagree.
However hard she tried, she failed.
Try as he might, he couldn't succeed.
Brilliant though she is, she lacks experience.

grammarPoints.koreanTip: much as, however + 형용사, try as I might 등은 고급 양보 표현이에요.
